thread.title: Mike Pence and family debut pet rabbit, Marlon Bundo
thread.title_full: Mike Pence and family debut pet rabbit, Marlon Bundo

title: Mike Pence and family debut pet rabbit, Marlon Bundo
text:
By Emily Schultheis CBS News January 9, 2017, 4:56 PM Mike Pence and family debut pet rabbit, Marlon Bundo 
Vice President-elect Mike Pence with his wife Karen, daughter Charlotte, cats Pickle and Oreo and rabbit Marlon Bundo. Mike Pence Stumble 
When Vice President-elect Mike Pence and his family move into the Naval Observatory, they’ll be accompanied by a new furry friend: a rabbit named Marlon Bundo. 
Marlon the rabbit, whose name is a play on the name of actor Marlon Brando, accompanied the Pences to D.C. on Monday on Air Force Two. The Pences also have two cats, Oreo and Pickle. 
Presidential pets are a tradition both at the White House and the Naval Observatory: the Obamas have two Portuguese water dogs, Bo and Sunny, and the Bidens have a German Shepherd named Champ. 
Pence posted a photo of the family on board the plane, with daughter Charlotte holding Marlon and Oreo and Pickle visible next to his wife, Karen: Thanks to @usairforce for a great flight to Washington, DC with Karen, Charlotte, Oreo, Pickle and our rabbit, Marlon Bundo. pic.twitter.com/zKzZYcI9OE — Mike Pence (@mike_pence) January 9, 2017 © 2017 CBS Interactive Inc. All Rights Reserved.
